law.name: Genesis
law.author: Moses
law.description: The book of beginnings - creation, fall, flood, and the patriarchal narratives of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and Joseph.
law.historicalSetting: From creation through Israel's descent into Egypt during the famine

law.name: Exodus
law.author: Moses
law.description: God's deliverance of Israel from Egyptian slavery, the giving of the Law at Sinai, and instructions for the tabernacle.
law.historicalSetting: Israel's 430-year bondage in Egypt and their miraculous exodus under Moses' leadership

law.name: Leviticus
law.author: Moses
law.description: Detailed instructions for worship, sacrifices, priestly duties, and holy living for the covenant community.
law.historicalSetting: Israel encamped at Mount Sinai receiving detailed ceremonial and moral laws

law.name: Numbers
law.author: Moses
law.description: Israel's 40-year wilderness journey, including censuses, rebellions, and preparation for entering Canaan.
law.historicalSetting: The wilderness wanderings from Sinai to the plains of Moab, east of the Jordan River

law.name: Deuteronomy
law.author: Moses
law.description: Moses' farewell addresses to Israel, reviewing the law and preparing them for life in the Promised Land.
law.historicalSetting: The plains of Moab, just before Israel's entry into Canaan under Joshua's leadership

history.name: Joshua
history.author: Joshua/Samuel
history.description: The conquest and division of the Promised Land under Joshua's leadership.
history.historicalSetting: Israel's military campaigns to conquer Canaan and the subsequent division of the land among the twelve tribes

history.name: Judges
history.author: Samuel
history.description: The cyclical pattern of Israel's apostasy, oppression, repentance, and deliverance through various judges.
history.historicalSetting: The chaotic period between the conquest and the monarchy, characterized by moral and spiritual decline

history.name: Ruth
history.author: Samuel
history.description: A beautiful story of loyalty, redemption, and God's providence in the life of a Moabite woman.
history.historicalSetting: During the time of the judges, showing God's grace working through ordinary people

history.name: 1 Samuel
history.author: Samuel/Nathan/Gad
history.description: The transition from judges to kings, featuring Samuel, Saul, and the rise of David.
history.historicalSetting: Israel's demand for a king and the establishment of the monarchy under Saul

history.name: 2 Samuel
history.author: Nathan/Gad
history.description: David's reign as king, including his triumphs, failures, and God's covenant promises.
history.historicalSetting: David's 40-year reign over Israel, establishing Jerusalem as the capital and expanding the kingdom

history.name: 1 Kings
history.author: Unknown (possibly Jeremiah)
history.description: Solomon's reign, the building of the temple, and the division of the kingdom.
history.historicalSetting: From Solomon's glorious reign through the kingdom's division into Israel (north) and Judah (south)

history.name: 2 Kings
history.author: Unknown (possibly Jeremiah)
history.description: The decline and fall of both kingdoms, ending with the Babylonian exile.
history.historicalSetting: The final centuries of the divided kingdom, culminating in the Assyrian conquest of Israel and Babylonian conquest of Judah

wisdom.name: Job
wisdom.author: Unknown (possibly Moses)
wisdom.description: The testing of a righteous man and the question of why the godly suffer.
wisdom.historicalSetting: Likely during the patriarchal period, in the land of Uz (possibly Edom)

wisdom.name: Psalms
wisdom.author: David and others
wisdom.description: A collection of songs, prayers, and poems expressing the full range of human emotion in worship.
wisdom.historicalSetting: Spanning from Moses to the post-exilic period, reflecting Israel's worship and spiritual life

wisdom.name: Proverbs
wisdom.author: Solomon and others
wisdom.description: Practical wisdom for daily living, emphasizing the fear of the Lord as the beginning of wisdom.
wisdom.historicalSetting: Primarily from Solomon's reign, with additional material from other wise men

wisdom.name: Ecclesiastes
wisdom.author: Solomon
wisdom.description: A philosophical reflection on the meaning of life and the vanity of earthly pursuits.
wisdom.historicalSetting: Solomon's reflections in his later years, possibly after his spiritual decline and restoration

wisdom.name: Song of Solomon
wisdom.author: Solomon
wisdom.description: A celebration of love and marriage, often interpreted as an allegory of God's love for His people.
wisdom.historicalSetting: Solomon's court, celebrating the beauty and sanctity of marital love

prophets.name: Isaiah
prophets.author: Isaiah
prophets.description: Prophecies of judgment and salvation, with extensive messianic predictions and visions of God's glory.
prophets.historicalSetting: Judah during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, facing Assyrian threats

prophets.name: Jeremiah
prophets.author: Jeremiah
prophets.description: The weeping prophet's calls to repentance and prophecies of Babylonian exile and restoration.
prophets.historicalSetting: Judah's final decades before the Babylonian exile, during the reigns of Josiah through Zedekiah

prophets.name: Lamentations
prophets.author: Jeremiah
prophets.description: Poetic laments over the destruction of Jerusalem and the temple.
prophets.historicalSetting: The immediate aftermath of Jerusalem's destruction by the Babylonians

prophets.name: Ezekiel
prophets.author: Ezekiel
prophets.description: Visions of God's glory, prophecies of judgment and restoration, and the vision of a new temple.
prophets.historicalSetting: Among the Jewish exiles in Babylon, before and after Jerusalem's destruction

prophets.name: Daniel
prophets.author: Daniel
prophets.description: Stories of faithfulness in exile and apocalyptic visions of future kingdoms and the end times.
prophets.historicalSetting: The Babylonian and Persian courts, spanning from Nebuchadnezzar to Cyrus

gospels.name: Matthew
gospels.author: Matthew
gospels.description: Jesus presented as the promised Messiah and King, with emphasis on His teachings and fulfillment of prophecy.
gospels.historicalSetting: Written primarily for Jewish Christians, demonstrating Jesus as the fulfillment of Old Testament promises

gospels.name: Mark
gospels.author: Mark
gospels.description: A fast-paced account of Jesus as the suffering Servant, emphasizing His actions and sacrifice.
gospels.historicalSetting: Written for Roman Christians, emphasizing Jesus' power and authority through His deeds

gospels.name: Luke
gospels.author: Luke
gospels.description: A careful historical account presenting Jesus as the perfect Son of Man, emphasizing His compassion for all people.
gospels.historicalSetting: Written for Gentile Christians, particularly Theophilus, emphasizing Jesus' humanity and universal appeal

gospels.name: John
gospels.author: John
gospels.description: A theological presentation of Jesus as the Son of God, focusing on His divine nature and eternal life.
gospels.historicalSetting: Written later than the synoptic gospels, addressing the full deity of Christ against early heresies

letters.name: Romans
letters.author: Paul
letters.description: Paul's systematic presentation of the gospel, covering sin, salvation, sanctification, and God's plan for Israel.
letters.historicalSetting: Written from Corinth to the Roman church Paul had not yet visited, laying theological groundwork

letters.name: 1 Corinthians
letters.author: Paul
letters.description: Addressing divisions and moral issues in the Corinthian church, with teachings on love, gifts, and resurrection.
letters.historicalSetting: Written from Ephesus to address serious problems in the cosmopolitan Corinthian church

letters.name: 2 Corinthians
letters.author: Paul
letters.description: Paul's defense of his apostolic ministry and teachings on suffering, giving, and reconciliation.
letters.historicalSetting: Written after a painful visit to Corinth, defending Paul's ministry against false apostles

letters.name: Galatians
letters.author: Paul
letters.description: A passionate defense of justification by faith alone against the Judaizers who taught salvation by works.
letters.historicalSetting: Written to churches in Galatia being influenced by Judaizers who taught circumcision was necessary for salvation

letters.name: Ephesians
letters.author: Paul
letters.description: The church as the body of Christ, emphasizing spiritual blessings, unity, and spiritual warfare.
letters.historicalSetting: Written during Paul's Roman imprisonment, possibly as a circular letter to churches in Asia Minor

letters.name: Philippians
letters.author: Paul
letters.description: A joyful letter emphasizing contentment, humility, and pressing toward the goal in Christ.
letters.historicalSetting: Written from Roman prison to thank the Philippians for their support and encourage their faithfulness
